data_table.description: ECG Serial Change, Exam 3. Participants with or without atherosclerosis and cardiovascular disease and involved in the "Atherosclerosis Risk in Communities (ARIC) Cohort" project.

variable.name: ESMB5
variable.description: Q-QS pattern (1xx) I aVL V6 - 1ST ECG [ECG Serial Change, exam 3]
variable.value: Q/R amplitude ratio more or equal to 1/3, plus Q duration more or equal 0.02 sec and < 0.03 sec in lead I or V6
Q duration more or equal to 0.03 sec and < 0.04 sec in lead I or V6
Q/R amplitude ratio more or equal to 1/5 and < 1/3, plus Q duration more or equal to 0.02 sec and < 0.03 sec in lead I or V6
Q duration more or equal to 0.03 sec and < 0.04 sec, plus R amplitude more or equal to 3 mm in lead aVL

variable.name: ESMB6
variable.description: Q-QS pattern (1xx) II III aVF - 1st ECG [ECG Serial Change, exam 3]
variable.value: Q/R amplitude ratio more or equal to 1/3, plus Q duration equal to 0.03 sec in lead II
Q duration more or equal to 0.05 sec in lead III, plus a Q-wave amplitude more or equal 1.0 mm in the majority of beats in lead aVF
Q/R amplitude ratio more or equal to 1/3, plus Q duration more or equal 0.02 sec and < 0.03 sec in lead II
Q duration more or equal 0.04 sec and < 0.05 sec in lead III, plus a Q-wave more or equal to 1.0 mm amplitude in the majority of beats in aVF
Q amplitude more or equal 5.0 mm in leads III or aVF
Q/R amplitude ratio more or equal to 1/5 and < 1/3, plus Q duration more or equal to 0.02 sec and < 0.03 sec in lead II
Q duration more or equal to 0.03 sec and < 0.04 sec in lead III, plus a Q-wave equal to 1.0 mm amplitude in the majority of beats in lead aVF
QS pattern in each of leads III and aVF. (Do not code in the presence of 7-1-1.)

variable.name: ESMB7
variable.description: Q-QS pattern (1xx) V1-V5 - 1ST ECG [ECG Serial Change, exam 3]
variable.value: Q/R amplitude ratio more or equal to 1/3 plus Q duration more or equal to 0.03 sec in any of leads V2, V3, V4, V5
QS pattern when initial R-wave is present in adjacent lead to the right on the chest, in any of leads V2-V6
QS pattern in all of leads V1-V4 or V1-V5
Q/R amplitude ratio more or equal to 1/3, plus Q duration more or equal to 0.02 sec and < 0.03 sec, in any of leads V2, V3, V4, V5
QS pattern in all of leads V1, V2, and V3. (Do not code in the presence of 7-1-1)
QS pattern in lead V1 and V2. (Do not code in the presence of 3-1 or 7-1-1.)

variable.name: ESMB8
variable.description: ST segment depression (4xx) I aVL V6 - 1ST ECG [ECG Serial Change, exam 3]
variable.value: STJ depression more or equal to 0.5 mm and < 1.0 mm and ST segment horizontal or downward sloping in any of leads I, aVL, or V6
STJ depression more or equal to 0.5 mm and < 1.0 mm and ST segment horizontal or downward sloping in any of leads I, aVL, or V6
No STJ depression as much as 0.5 mm but ST segment downward sloping and segment or T-wave nadir more or equal to 0.5 mm below P-R baseline, in any of leads I, aVL, or V6
No STJ depression as much as 0.5 mm but ST segment downward sloping and segment or T-wave nadir more or equal to 0.5 mm below P-R baseline, in any of leads I, aVL, or V6
STJ depression more or equal to 1.0 mm but < 2.0 mm, and ST segment horizontal or downward sloping in any of leads I, aVL, or V6

variable.name: ESMB9
variable.description: ST segment depression (4xx) II III aVF - 1ST ECG [ECG Serial Change, exam 3]
variable.value: STJ depression more or equal to 0.5 mm and < 1.0 mm and ST segment horizontal or downward sloping in lead II or aVF
No STJ depression as much as 0.5 mm, but ST segment downward sloping and segment or T-wave nadir more or equal to 0.5 mm below P-R baseline in lead II

variable.name: ESMB10
variable.description: ST segment depression (4xx) V1-V5 - 1ST ECG [ECG Serial Change, exam 3]
variable.value: STJ depression more or equal to 0.5 mm and < 1.0 mm and ST segment horizontal or downward sloping in any of leads V1 - V5
STJ depression more or equal to 0.5 mm and < 1.0 mm and ST segment horizontal or downward sloping in any of leads V1 - V5
No STJ depression as much as 0.5 mm, but ST segment downward sloping and segment or T-wave nadir more or equal to 0.5 mm below P-R baseline in any of leads V2 - V5
No STJ depression as much as 0.5 mm, but ST segment downward sloping and segment or T-wave nadir more or equal to 0.5 mm below P-R baseline in any of leads V2 - V5
STJ depression more or equal to 2.0 and ST segment horizontal or downward sloping in any of leads V1, V2, V3, V4, V5
STJ depression more or equal to 1.0 mm but < 2.0 mm and ST segment horizontal or downward sloping in any of leads V1-V5

variable.name: ESMB11
variable.description: T wave (5x) I aVL V6 - 1ST ECG [ECG Serial Change, exam 3]
variable.value: Missing

T amplitude negative or diphasic (positive-negative or negative-positive type) with negative phase at least 1.0 mm but not as deep as 5.0 mm in lead I or V6, or in lead aVL when R amplitude is more or equal to 5.0 mm
T amplitude zero (flat), or negative, or diphasic (negative-positive type only) with less than 1.0 mm negative phase in lead I or V6, or in lead aVL when R amplitude is more or equal to 5.0 mm
T amplitude positive and T/R amplitude ratio < 1/20 in any of leads I, aVL, V6; R wave amplitude must be more or equal to 10.0 mm

variable.name: ESMB12
variable.description: T wave (5x) II III aVF - 1st ECG [ECG Serial Change, exam 3]
variable.value: T amplitude negative or diphasic with negative phase (negative-positive or positive-negative type) at least 1.0 mm but not as deep as 5.0 mm in lead II, or in lead aVF when QRS is mainly upright
T amplitude zero (flat), or negative, or diphasic (negative-positive type only) with less than 1.0 mm negative phase in lead II; not coded in lead aVF
T amplitude positive and T/R amplitude ratio < 1/20 in any of leads I, aVL, V6; R wave amplitude must be more or equal to 10.0 mm

variable.name: ESMB13
variable.description: T wave (5x) V1-V5 - 1st ECG [ECG Serial Change, exam 3]
variable.value: T amplitude negative 5.0 mm or more in any of leads V1-V5
T amplitude negative (flat), or diphasic (negative-positive or positive-negative type) with negative phase at least 1.0 mm but not as deep as 5.0 mm, in any of leads V1-V5
T amplitude zero (flat), or negative, or diphasic (negative-positive type only) with less than 1.0 mm negative phase, in any of leads V3-V5
T amplitude positive and T/R amplitude ratio < 1/20 in any of leads V3-V5; R wave amplitude must be more or equal to 10.0 mm

variable.name: ESMB14
variable.description: ST segment elevation (92x) I aVL V6 - 1st ECG [ECG Serial Change, exam 3]

variable.name: ESMB15
variable.description: ST segment elevation (92x) II III aVF - 1st ECG [ECG Serial Change, exam 3]

variable.name: ESMB16
variable.description: ST seg elevation (92x) V1-V5 - 1ST ECG [ECG Serial Change, exam 3]
variable.value: ST segment elevation more or equal to 1.0 mm in lead V5 or ST segment elevation more or equal to 2.0 mm in any of leads V1, V2, V3, V4

variable.name: ESMB17
variable.description: R (3x) - 1st ECG [ECG Serial Change, exam 3]
variable.value: Left: R amplitude > 26 mm in either V5 or V6, or R amplitude > 20.0 mm in any of leads I, II, III, aVF, or R

Right: R amplitude more or equal to 5.0 mm and R amplitude more or equal to S amplitude in the majority of beats in lead V1, when S amplitude is > R amplitude somewhere to the left on the chest of V1 (codes 7-3 and 3-2, if criteria for both are present).

Left (optional code when 3-1 is not present): R amplitude > 15.0 mm but " 20.0 mm in lead I, or R amplitude in V5 or V6, plus S amplitude in V1 > 35.0 mm. (Measured only on second to last complete normal beat.)

variable.name: ESMB18
variable.description: A-V conduction defect (6xx) - 1st ECG [ECG Serial Change, exam 3]
variable.value: P-R (P-Q) interval more or equal to 0.22 sec in the majority of beats in any of leads I, II, III, aVL, aVF
P-R (P-Q) interval more or equal to 0.22 sec in the majority of beats in any of leads I, II, III, aVL, aVF
Short P-R interval. P-R interval < 0.12 sec in all beats of any two of leads I, II, III, aVL, aVF

variable.name: ESMB19
variable.description: Ventricular conduction defect (7xx) - 1st ECG [ECG Serial Change, exam 3]
variable.value: Incomplete right bundle branch block. QRS duration < 0.12 sec in each of leads I, II, III, aVL, aVF, and R' > R in either of leads V1, V2 . (Code as 3-2 in addition if those criteria are met. 7-3 suppresses code 1-2-8.)

Incomplete right bundle branch block. QRS duration < 0.12 sec in each of leads I, II, III, aVL, aVF, and R' > R in either of leads V1, V2 . (Code as 3-2 in addition if those criteria are met. 7-3 suppresses code 1-2-8.)
Intraventricular block. QRS duration = 0.12 sec in a majority of beats in any of leads I, II, III, aVL, aVF. (7-4 suppresses all 2, 3, 4, 5, 9-2, 9-4, 9-5 codes.)
R-R' pattern in either of leads V1, V2 with R' amplitude more or equal to R

Incomplete left bundle branch block. (Do not code in the presence of any cod able Q- or QS-wave.) QRS duration more or equal to 0.10 sec and < 0.12 in the majority of beats of each of leads I, aVL, and V5 or V6

Complete left bundle branch block (LBBB). (Do not code in presence of 6-1, 6-4-1, 6-8, 8-2-1 or 8-2-2.) QRS duration more or equal to 0.12 sec in a majority of beats in any of leads I, II, III, aVL, aVF, plus R peak duration equal to 0.06 sec in a majority of beats (of the same QRS pattern) in any of leads I, II, aVL, V5, V6. (7-1-1 suppresses 1-2-3, 1-2-7, 1- 2-8, 1-3-2, 1-3-6, all 2, 3, 4, 5, 9-2, 9-4, 9-5 codes. If any other cod able Q-wave coexists with the LBBB pattern, code the Q and diminish the 7-1-1 code to a 7-4 code.)

Complete right bundle branch block (RBBB). (Do not code in the presence of 6-1, 6-4-1, 6-8, 8-2-1 or 8-2-2.) QRS duration more or equal to 0.12 sec in a majority of beats in any of leads I, II, III, aVL, aVF, plus: R' > R in V1 or V2; or QRS mainly upright, with R peak duration equal to 0.06 sec in V1 or V2; or S duration >R duration in all beats in lead I or II. (7-1 suppresses 1-2-3, 1-2-7, 1-2-8, 1-3-2, 1-3-6, all 2, 3, 4, 5, 9-2, 9-4, 9-5 codes

variable.name: ESMB20
variable.description: Misc (9x) 1x - 1st ECG [ECG Serial Change, exam 3]
variable.value: Low QRS amplitude. QRS peak-to-peak amplitude < 5 mm in all beats in each of leads I, II, III, or < 10 mm in all beats in each of leads V1, V2, V3, V4, V5, V6. (Check calibration before coding.)

variable.name: ESMB21
variable.description: Misc (9x) 3x - 1st ECG [ECG Serial Change, exam 3]
variable.value: P-wave amplitude more or equal to 2.5 mm in any of leads II, III, aVF, in a majority of beats

variable.name: ESMB22
variable.description: Misc (9x) 5x - 1st ECG [ECG Serial Change, exam 3]
variable.value: T-wave amplitude > 12 mm in any of leads I, II, III, aVL, aVF, V1, V2, V3, V4, V5, V6. (Do not code in the presence of 6-4-1, 7-1-1, 7-2-1 or 7-4.)

variable.name: ESMB23
variable.description: U wave (blank) - 1st ECG [ECG Serial Change, exam 3]

variable.name: ESMB24
variable.description: Suppression 8 - 1st ECG [ECG Serial Change, exam 3]

variable.name: ESMB25
variable.description: Technical problem (98x) - 1st ECG [ECG Serial Change, exam 3]

variable.name: ESMB26
variable.description: Clear - 1st ECG [ECG Serial Change, exam 3]

variable.name: ESMB27
variable.description: B1: suppression pattern (6xx) - 1st ECG [ECG Serial Change, exam 3]

variable.name: ESMB28
variable.description: C1: type of suppression (6xx) - 1st ECG [ECG Serial Change, exam 3]

variable.name: ESMB29
variable.description: D1: bundle branch block - 1st ECG [ECG Serial Change, exam 3]

variable.name: ESMB30
variable.description: E1: major Q I aVL V6 - 1st ECG [ECG Serial Change, exam 3]

variable.name: ESMB31
variable.description: F1: minor Q I aVL V6 - 1st ECG [ECG Serial Change, exam 3]

variable.name: ESMB32
variable.description: G1: major Q II III aVF - 1st ECG [ECG Serial Change, exam 3]

variable.name: ESMB33
variable.description: H1: minor Q II III aVF - 1st ECG [ECG Serial Change, exam 3]

variable.name: ESMB34
variable.description: I1: major Q V1-V5 - 1st ECG [ECG Serial Change, exam 3]

variable.name: ESMB35
variable.description: J1: minor Q V1-V5 - 1st ECG [ECG Serial Change, exam 3]

variable.name: ESMB36
variable.description: ECG technician - follow up ECG - blank [ECG Serial Change, exam 3]

variable.name: ESMB40
variable.description: Q-Qs pattern (1xx) I aVL V6 - follow up ECG [ECG Serial Change, exam 3]
variable.value: Q/R amplitude ratio more or equal to 1/3, plus Q duration more or equal to 0.03 sec in lead I or V6
Q duration more or equal to 0.04 sec, plus R amplitude more or equal to 3 mm in lead aVL
Q/R amplitude ratio more or equal to 1/3, plus Q duration more or equal to 0.02 sec and < 0.03 sec in lead I or V6
Q duration more or equal 0.03 sec and < 0.04 sec in lead I or V6
Initial R amplitude decreasing to 2 mm or less in every beat (and absence of codes 3-2, 7-1-1, 7-2-1, or 7-3 between V5 and V6. (All beats in lead V5 must have an initial R > 2 mm.)
Q/R amplitude ratio more or equal 1/5 and < 1/3, plus Q duration more or equal to 0.02 sec and < 0.03 sec in lead I or V6
Q duration more or equal to 0.03 sec and < 0.04 sec, plus R amplitude more or equal to 3 mm in lead aVL

variable.name: ESMB41
variable.description: Q-QS pattern (1xx) II III aVF - follow up ECG [ECG Serial Change, exam 3]
variable.value: Q/R amplitude ratio more or equal to 1/3, plus Q duration equal to 0.03 sec in lead II
Q duration more or equal to 0.05 sec in lead III, plus a Q-wave amplitude more or equal to 1.0 mm in the majority of beats in lead aVF
Q duration more or equal to 0.05 sec in lead aVF
Q/R amplitude ratio more or equal to 1/3, plus Q duration more or equal to 0.02 sec and < 0.03 sec in lead II
Q duration more or equal to 0.03 sec and < 0.04 sec in lead II
QS pattern in lead II. Do not code in the presence of 7-1-1
Q duration more or equal to 0.04 sec and < 0.05 sec in lead III, plus a Q-wave more or equal to 1.0 mm amplitude in the majority of beats in aVF
Q duration more or equal to 0.04 sec and < 0.05 sec in lead aVF
Q amplitude more or equal to 5.0 mm in leads III or aVF
Q/R amplitude ratio more or equal to 1/5 and < 1/3, plus Q duration equal to 0.02 sec and < 0.03 sec in lead II
Q duration more or equal to 0.03 sec and < 0.04 sec in lead III, plus a Q-wave more or equal to 1.0 mm amplitude in the majority of beats in lead aVF
Q duration more or equal to 0.03 sec and < 0.04 sec in lead aVF
QS pattern in each of leads III and aVF. (Do not code in the presence of 7-1-1.)

variable.name: ESMB42
variable.description: Q-QS pattern (1xx) V1-V5 - follow up ECG [ECG Serial Change, exam 3]
variable.value: Q/R amplitude ratio more or equal to 1/3 plus Q duration more or equal to 0.03 sec in any of leads V2-V5
Q duration more or equal to 0.04 sec in any of leads V1-V5
QS pattern when initial R-wave is present in adjacent lead to the right on the chest, in any of leads V2-V6
QS pattern in all of leads V1-V4 or V1-V5
Q/R amplitude ratio more or equal to 1/3, plus Q duration more or equal to 0.02 sec and < 0.03 sec, in any of leads V2-V5
Q duration more or equal to 0.03 sec and < 0.04 sec in any of leads V2-V5
QS pattern in all of leads V1, V2, and V3. (Do not code in the presence of 7-1-1)

Initial R amplitude decreasing to 2.0 mm or less in every beat (and absence of codes 3-2, 7-1-1, 7-2-1, or 7-3) between any of leads V2 and V3, V3 and V4, or V4 and V5. (All beats in the lead immediately to the right on the chest must have an initial R >
QS pattern in lead V1 and V2. (Do not code in the presence of 3-1 or 7-1-1.)

variable.name: ESMB43
variable.description: ST segment depression (4xx) I aVL V6 - follow up ECG [ECG Serial Change, exam 3]
variable.value: STJ depression more or equal to 0.5 mm and < 1.0 mm and ST segment horizontal or downward sloping in any of leads I, aVL, or V6
STJ depression more or equal to 0.5 mm and < 1.0 mm and ST segment horizontal or downward sloping in any of leads I, aVL, or V6
No STJ depression as much as 0.5 mm but ST segment downward sloping and segment or T-wave nadir more or equal to 0.5 mm below P-R baseline, in any of leads I, aVL, or V6
No STJ depression as much as 0.5 mm but ST segment downward sloping and segment or T-wave nadir more or equal to 0.5 mm below P-R baseline, in any of leads I, aVL, or V6
STJ depression more or equal to 1.0 mm but < 2.0 mm, and ST segment horizontal or downward sloping in any of leads I, aVL, or V6

variable.name: ESMB44
variable.description: ST segment depression (4xx) II III aVF - follow up ECG [ECG Serial Change, exam 3]
variable.value: STJ depression more or equal 0.5 mm and < 1.0 mm and ST segment horizontal or downward sloping in lead II or aVF
STJ depression more or equal 0.5 mm and < 1.0 mm and ST segment horizontal or downward sloping in lead II or aVF
No STJ depression as much as 0.5 mm, but ST segment downward sloping and segment or T-wave nadir more or equal 0.5 mm below P-R baseline in lead II
No STJ depression as much as 0.5 mm, but ST segment downward sloping and segment or T-wave nadir more or equal 0.5 mm below P-R baseline in lead II
STJ depression more or equal to 1.0 mm but < 2.0 mm, and ST segment horizontal or downward sloping in any of leads I, aVL, or V6

variable.name: ESMB45
variable.description: ST segment depression (4xx) V1-V5 - follow up ECG [ECG Serial Change, exam 3]
variable.value: STJ depression more or equal to 0.5 mm and < 1.0 mm and ST segment horizontal or downward sloping in any of leads V1 - V5
No STJ depression as much as 0.5 mm, but ST segment downward sloping and segment or T-wave nadir more or equal to 0.5 mm below P-R baseline in any of leads V2 - V5
STJ depression more or equal to 1.0 mm and ST segment upward sloping or U-shaped in any of leads V1 - V5
STJ depression more or equal to 2.0 and ST segment horizontal or downward sloping in any of leads V1-V5
STJ depression more or equal to 1.0 mm but < 2.0 mm and ST segment horizontal or downward sloping in any of leads V1-V5

variable.name: ESMB46
variable.description: T wave (5x) I aVL V6 - follow up ECG [ECG Serial Change, exam 3]
variable.value: T amplitude negative 5.0 mm or more in either of leads I, V6, or in lead aVL when R amplitude is more or equal to 5.0 mm

T amplitude negative or diphasic (positive-negative or negative-positive type) with negative phase at least 1.0 mm but not as deep as 5.0 mm in lead I or V6, or in lead aVL when R amplitude is more or equal to 5.0 mm
T amplitude zero (flat), or negative, or diphasic (negative-positive type only) with less than 1.0 mm negative phase in lead I or V6, or in lead aVL when R amplitude is more or equal to 5.0 mm
T amplitude positive and T/R amplitude ratio < 1/20 in any of leads I, aVL, V6; R wave amplitude must be more or equal to 10.0 mm

variable.name: ESMB47
variable.description: T wave (5x) II III aVF - follow up ECG [ECG Serial Change, exam 3]
variable.value: T amplitude negative or diphasic with negative phase (negative-positive or positive-negative type) at least 1.0 mm but not as deep as 5.0 mm in lead II, or in lead aVF when QRS is mainly upright
T amplitude zero (flat), or negative, or diphasic (negative-positive type only) with less than 1.0 mm negative phase in lead II; not coded in lead aVF

variable.name: ESMB48
variable.description: T wave (5x) V1-V5 - follow up ECG [ECG Serial Change, exam 3]
variable.value: T amplitude negative 5.0 mm or more in any of leads V2, V3, V4, V5
T amplitude negative or diphasic with negative phase (negative-positive or positive-negative type) at least 1.0 mm but not as deep as 5.0 mm in lead II, or in lead aVF when QRS is mainly upright
T amplitude zero (flat), or negative, or diphasic (negative-positive type only) with less than 1.0 mm negative phase in lead II; not coded in lead aVF
T amplitude positive and T/R amplitude ratio < 1/20 in any of leads V3, V4, V5; R wave amplitude must be = 10.0 mm

variable.name: ESMB49
variable.description: ST segment elevation (92x) I aVL V6 - follow up ECG [ECG Serial Change, exam 3]

variable.name: ESMB50
variable.description: ST segment elevation (92x) II III aVF - follow up ECG [ECG Serial Change, exam 3]
variable.value: ST segment elevation more or equal to 1.0 mm in any of leads II, III, aVF

variable.name: ESMB51
variable.description: ST segment elevation (92x) V1-V5 - follow up ECG [ECG Serial Change, exam 3]
variable.value: ST segment elevation more or equal to 1.0 mm in lead V5 or ST segment elevation equal to 2.0 mm in any of leads V1-V4

variable.name: ESMB52
variable.description: R (3x) - follow up ECG [ECG Serial Change, exam 3]
variable.value: Left: R amplitude > 26 mm in either V5 or V6, or R amplitude > 20.0 mm in any of leads I, II, III, aVF, or R amplitude > 12.0 mm in lead aVL. (All criteria measured only on second to last complete normal beat.)

Right: R amplitude more or equal to 5.0 mm and R amplitude more or equal to S amplitude in the majority of beats in lead V1, when S amplitude is > R amplitude somewhere to the left on the chest of V1 (codes 7-3 and 3-2, if criteria for both are present).

Left (optional code when 3-1 is not present): R amplitude > 15.0 mm but " 20.0 mm in lead I, or R amplitude in V5 or V6, plus S amplitude in V1 > 35.0 mm. (Measured only on second to last complete normal beat.)

variable.name: ESMB53
variable.description: AV conduction defect (6xx) - follow up ECG [ECG Serial Change, exam 3]
variable.value: P-R (P-Q) interval more or equal to 0.22 sec in the majority of beats in any of leads I, II, III, aVL, aVF
Short P-R interval. P-R interval < 0.12 sec in all beats of any two of leads I, II, III, aVL, aVF

variable.name: ESMB54
variable.description: Ventricular conduction defect (7xx) - follow up ECG [ECG Serial Change, exam 3]
variable.value: Incomplete right bundle branch block. QRS duration < 0.12 sec in each of leads I, II, III, aVL, aVF, and R' > R in either of leads V1, V2 .(Code as 3-2 in addition if those criteria are met. 7-3 suppresses code 1-2-8.)
Intraventricular block. QRS duration more or equal to 0.12 sec in a majority of beats in any of leads I, II, III, aVL, aVF. (7-4 suppresses all 2, 3, 4, 5, 9-2, 9-4, 9-5 codes.)
R-R' pattern in either of leads V1, V2 with R' amplitude more or equal to R

Incomplete left bundle branch block. (Do not code in the presence of any cod able Q- or QS-wave.) QRS duration more or equal to 0.10 sec and < 0.12 in the majority of beats of each of leads I, aVL, and V5 or V6

Complete right bundle branch block (RBBB). (Do not code in the presence of 6-1, 6-4-1, 6-8, 8-2-1 or 8-2-2.) QRS duration more or equal to 0.12 sec in a majority of beats in any of leads I, II, III, aVL, aVF, plus: R' > R in V1 or V2; or QRS mainly upright, with R peak

variable.name: ESMB55
variable.description: Misc (9x) 1x - follow up ECG [ECG Serial Change, exam 3]
variable.value: Low QRS amplitude. QRS peak-to-peak amplitude < 5 mm in all beats in each of leads I, II, III, or < 10 mm in all beats in each of leads V1, V2, V3, V4, V5, V6. (Check calibration before coding.)

variable.name: ESMB56
variable.description: Misc (9x) 3x - follow up ECG [ECG Serial Change, exam 3]
variable.value: P-wave amplitude more or equal to 2.5 mm in any of leads II, III, aVF, in a majority of beats

variable.name: ESMB57
variable.description: Misc (9x) 5x - follow up ECG [ECG Serial Change, exam 3]

variable.name: ESMB58
variable.description: U wave (blank) - follow up ECG [ECG Serial Change, exam 3]

variable.name: ESMB59
variable.description: Suppression 8 - follow up ECG [ECG Serial Change, exam 3]

variable.name: ESMB60
variable.description: Technical problem (98x) - follow up ECG [ECG Serial Change, exam 3]

variable.name: ESMB61
variable.description: Clear - follow up ECG [ECG Serial Change, exam 3]

variable.name: ESMB62
variable.description: B2: suppression pat (6xx) - follow up ECG [ECG Serial Change, exam 3]

variable.name: ESMB63
variable.description: C2: type of suppression (6xx) - follow up ECG [ECG Serial Change, exam 3]

variable.name: ESMB64
variable.description: D2: bundle branch block - follow up ECG [ECG Serial Change, exam 3]

variable.name: ESMB65
variable.description: E2: major Q I aVL V6 - follow up ECG [ECG Serial Change, exam 3]

variable.name: ESMB66
variable.description: F2: minor Q I aVL V6 - follow up ECG [ECG Serial Change, exam 3]

variable.name: ESMB67
variable.description: G2: major Q II III aVF - follow up ECG [ECG Serial Change, exam 3]

variable.name: ESMB68
variable.description: H2: minor Q II III aVF - follow up ECG [ECG Serial Change, exam 3]

variable.name: ESMB69
variable.description: I2: major Q V1-V5 - follow up ECG [ECG Serial Change, exam 3]

variable.name: ESMB70
variable.description: J2: minor Q V1-V5 - follow up ECG [ECG Serial Change, exam 3]

variable.name: ESMB71
variable.description: Visit or contact year [3] - follow up ECG [ECG Serial Change, exam 3]
